articles.title: Grandson of the inventor of Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups accuses Hershey of cutting corners
articles.description:
“How does The Hershey Co. continue to position Reese’s as its flagship brand, a symbol of trust, quality and leadership, while quietly replacing the very ingredients (Milk Chocolate + Peanut Butter) that built Reese’s trust in the first place?”

The post Grandson of the inventor of Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups accuses Hershey of cutting corners appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Grandson of Reese's inventor criticizes Hershey for altering key ingredients in products.
Hershey's changes affect the quality perception of the iconic Reese's brand.
Boston consumers may face reduced trust in Reese's products due to ingredient modifications.

articles.title: Turning 40 made her discover running. Ten years later, she’s running Boston.
articles.description:
"Running became a lifeline and an outlet for me."

The post Turning 40 made her discover running. Ten years later, she’s running Boston. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Melissa Rousselle discovered running at 40, transforming her life over the past decade.
She will participate in the Boston Marathon, marking her 10-year running journey.
Her story inspires Boston residents to consider running as a positive outlet.

articles.title: For $3 million, a Newton ‘painted lady’ with plenty of whimsy
articles.description:
Originally known as the Charles Davis House, the colorful Newton Center home was constructed in the Second Empire style in 1860.

The post For $3 million, a Newton ‘painted lady’ with plenty of whimsy appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Newton's Charles Davis House, a 1860 Victorian, is listed for $3 million.
The home features unique Second Empire architecture, attracting potential buyers in the area.
Local residents may see increased property values due to this high-profile listing.

articles.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office
articles.description:
Thames Valley Police previously said it was “assessing” reports that Mountbatten-Windsor sent confidential trade reports to Epstein in 2010, when the former prince was Britain’s special envoy for international trade.

The post Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor arrested for misconduct in public office on February 19, 2026.
Allegations involve sending confidential trade reports to Jeffrey Epstein in 2010.
Potential implications for international trade relations affecting Boston's business community.
